definition: variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: Problem with Orphans A gang of orphans scoured the city for scraps to live on.
sentences.chinese: 孤儿问题一群孤儿在城里四处搜索残羹剩饭混时度日。

sentences.english: Problem with Orphans A gang of orphans scoured the city for scraps to live on.
sentences.chinese: 孤儿问题一群孤儿在城里四处搜索残羹剩饭混时度日。

sentences.english: Lei was orphaned at 7 years old.
A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.
sentences.chinese: 神在他的圣所作孤儿的父，作寡妇的伸冤者。

sentences.english: Children mostly became orphans from being born out of wedlock or women dying in childbirth.
sentences.chinese: 通常非婚生或是母亲难产而死的孩子都沦为了孤儿。

sentences.english: They placed the orphans with foster-parents.
sentences.chinese: 他们为这些孤儿找到了养父养母。

sentences.english: A rare example of a Feeorin, Nym was orphaned at an early age.
sentences.chinese: 作为罕见的菲奥林人，尼姆很早就成了孤儿。

sentences.english: We will find a way to create an orphanage for them.
sentences.chinese: 我们会寻找方法为他们建立一所孤儿院。

sentences.english: The kind grandma shows her mercy on every orphan.
sentences.chinese: 这位仁慈的老奶奶对每个孤儿都很怜惜。

sentences.english: A Christian without a small group is an orphan.
sentences.chinese: 一个没有小组的基督徒就是一个孤儿。

sentences.english: I had the unique experience of working with a killer whale orphan.
sentences.chinese: 我有过跟一头雌性的孤儿虎鲸一起工作的特别经验。

sentences.english: People who want to adopt orphans should have the ability to raise them, Chen added.
sentences.chinese: 陈还补充说，想要收养孤儿的人需要有抚养能力。

sentences.english: As a result, the parents challenged the family to start an orphanage together in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 因此，家长质疑的家庭开始在墨西哥一家孤儿院一起。

sentences.english: Those in the orphanages needs cheerfulness.
sentences.chinese: 那些孤儿院需要欢呼声。

sentences.english: Some countries do have many young orphans.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家的确有许多年轻孤儿。

sentences.english: In the past, orphaned children were absorbed by their extended families.
sentences.chinese: 在过去，孤儿通常由他们的亲戚照养。

definition: to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
to have lost both one's parents
no one to rely on (idiom); on one's own/orphaned/left to one's own devices
to be orphaned of one's father
to offer shelter/to have sb in one's care
mutually dependent for life (idiom); to rely upon one another for survival/interdependent
